headline: Heard on the Street Recap: Betting on Cuts
summary: The Dow industrials added 0.9% and the Nasdaq composite gained 0.2%.  The "modest fall" should be enough to persuade Federal Reserve policymakers to vote for another rate cut next week, said Stephen Brown of Capital Economics.  The retailer’s stock was up 1.8%, a gain that pushed it above the market-cap milestone and made it the 12th U.S. company to surpass it, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

headline: Why Dollar Tree (DLTR) Stock Is Trading Up Today
summary: Shares of discount treasure-hunt retailer Dollar Tree (NASDAQ:DLTR) jumped 3.1% in the morning session after the company reported better-than-expected third-quarter financial results and raised its full-year profit outlook. The company announced adjusted earnings of $1.21 per share on sales of $4.75 billion, beating Wall Street's estimates of $1.08 per share and $4.7 billion in sales. Comparable-store sales, a key performance measure for retailers, grew by 4.2%, also topping expectations. Follow

headline: Dollar Tree Stock Rises as Retailer Closes Strong 2025 With a Bang
summary: Dollar Tree  stock rose Wednesday after the low-cost retailer reported better-than-expected quarterly earnings as cash-strapped consumers hunted for value.  Adjusted earnings came in at $1.21 a share for its fiscal third quarter, above analysts’ consensus estimate of $1.09.  Comparable-store sales, stripping out the Family Dollar business, which  Dollar Tree  sold in July, rose 4.2% from the prior year.

raw.headline: Dollar Tree Stock Rises as Retailer Closes Strong 2025 With a Bang
raw.summary: Dollar Tree  stock rose Wednesday after the low-cost retailer reported better-than-expected quarterly earnings as cash-strapped consumers hunted for value.  Adjusted earnings came in at $1.21 a share for its fiscal third quarter, above analysts’ consensus estimate of $1.09.  Comparable-store sales, stripping out the Family Dollar business, which  Dollar Tree  sold in July, rose 4.2% from the prior year.

headline: Alphabet's AI, ADP job data, Macy's & Dollar Tree: 3 Things
summary: Alphabet (GOOG, GOOGL) is taking the AI ecosystem by force with the latest iteration of its Nano Banana generator and Gemini chatbot, while Anthropic (ANTH.PVT) is reportedly eyeing an IPO. US stock futures (ES=F, NQ=F, YM=F) tick higher in Wednesday's premarket trading after ADP reported a monthly loss of 32,000 private sector jobs in November. Meanwhile, department store Macy's (M) and discount retailer Dollar Tree (DLTR) beat their respective earnings estimates. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Dollar Tree’s (NASDAQ:DLTR) Q3 CY2025: Beats On Revenue
summary: Discount treasure-hunt retailer Dollar Tree (NASDAQ:DLTR) reported Q3 CY2025 results topping the market’s revenue expectations, but sales fell by 37.2% year on year to $4.75 billion. Guidance for next quarter’s revenue was better than expected at $5.45 billion at the midpoint, 0.6% above analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.21 per share was 11.8% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

raw.headline: Dollar Tree’s (NASDAQ:DLTR) Q3 CY2025: Beats On Revenue

Guidance for next quarter’s revenue was better than expected at $5.45 billion at the midpoint, 0.6% above analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.21 per share was 11.8% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Stock Futures Rise as Risk Rebound Builds Steam
summary: Stock futures were rising on Wednesday, as investors carried on snapping up Bitcoin and other risk-on assets following a recent wobble.  Bitcoin, the largest cryptocurrency by total market capitalization, surged 7.4% over the past 24 hours to $92,893.  Earnings from retailers Macy’s and Dollar Tree could give investors a sense of how consumer spending is holding up.
